intro: Doritis taenialis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved doritis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, star-shaped flowers are often pink or purple, and it blooms during the warmer months. Doritis taenialis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in dry conditions.
